Interface Level

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
CombatLevel
public interface Level extends Serializable
Represents a game level interface. Defines the structure and behavior expected from any level implementation, including scenario details, turn tracking, and completion status.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    getCurrentMonsterIndex()
    Returns the index of the current monster being engaged.

    Checks whether the level is completed.

    Returns the scenario associated with the level.

    void
    start()
    Starts the level.

  • Method Details

    • start

      void start()
      Starts the level. Typically used to initialize the scenario and prepare the game state.

    • getIsCompleted

      boolean getIsCompleted()
      Checks whether the level is completed. A level is considered complete when its objectives are fulfilled.
      Returns:
      true if the level is completed, false otherwise

    • getScenario

      Scenario getScenario()
      Returns the scenario associated with the level.
      Returns:
      the Scenario object

    • getTurnCounter

      int getTurnCounter()
      Returns the current turn count.
      Returns:
      the number of turns elapsed

    • incrementTurnCounter

      void incrementTurnCounter()
      Increments the turn counter by one.

    • getCurrentMonsterIndex

      int getCurrentMonsterIndex()
      Returns the index of the current monster being engaged.
      Returns:
      the current monster index

    • incrementCurrentMonsterIndex

      void incrementCurrentMonsterIndex()
      Increments the current monster index by one.
